channel.title: Huddle
channel.description: Your first read on Capitol Hill politics and policy.

item.title: Trump huddles with House GOP
item.description: House Republicans will hear directly from President Donald Trump today for the first time since the administration’s extraordinary capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor

item.title: Congress confronts Venezuela fallout
item.description: Venezuela will dominate the congressional agenda this week, with Republicans lacking a unified vision on what happens next after the capture of Nicolás Maduro and the Senate poised to vote to limit further attacks without lawmaker approval.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt

item.title: Inside the GOP fight over reconciliation 2.0
item.description: Republicans face a nasty showdown in early 2026 over whether to take another swing at a party-line policy bill ahead of the midterms.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: This GOP trio is a thorn in Thune’s side
item.description: One year into John Thune’s stint as majority leader, a conservative trio has been causing many of his biggest headaches.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Six weeks to avoid a shutdown
item.description: Congress is in danger of needing to pass another short-term funding patch — or risk triggering another government shutdown — if lawmakers fail to quickly reach a funding deal once they return from the holidays.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: House Dems keep thwarting the GOP
item.description: House Republicans just wrapped a bruising end to the legislative year after Democrats repeatedly outmaneuvered GOP leaders and undercut the Republican agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Congress leaves health mess for January
item.description: Congress is about to leave town for the holidays — and put off their health care troubles until January.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Jack Smith jumps into a Judiciary minefield
item.dc:creator: By Hailey Fuchs, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Mia McCarthy
item.dc:contributor: By Hailey Fuchs, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Mia McCarthy

item.title: Parallel pushes for an 11th-hour health deal
item.description: Rank-and-file dealmakers in both chambers are making last-ditch attempts to extend key Obamacare subsidies this week, even as it becomes crystal clear the subsidies will expire first.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: House GOP at the Obamacare cliff
item.description: House Republicans are set to mark their final session week of 2025 with a muddled health care message that’s poised to have a big impact — a nationwide spike in insurance costs after Obamacare subsidies expire in less than three weeks.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor

item.title: Johnson’s next revolt: energy permitting
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson is facing another intraparty revolt — one that has nothing to do with health care, defense policy or pay for college athletes.
item.dc:creator: By Emma Dumain, Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Emma Dumain, Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP’s health revolt heads to the Senate
item.description: House Republicans just showed how divided they are over health care. Thursday's Senate votes could expose the party’s strife even further.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Johnson’s turn to deliver a health plan
item.description: All signs are pointing toward the expiration of enhanced Affordable Care Act subsidies by year's end.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: What Trump told POLITICO about health care
item.description: President Donald Trump in an interview with our Dasha Burns was noncommittal on the fate of Obamacare subsidies set to lapse at the end of the month, the latest sign that Republicans will let them expire.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP struggles on affordability message
item.description: The Senate is set to vote Thursday on whether to extend Obamacare health insurance subsidies that expire in 23 days. How Republicans will engage remains up in the air, as the party struggles more broadly to reach consensus on a range of “affordability” issues.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor and Mia McCarthy
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor and Mia McCarthy

item.title: Anger at Johnson threatens must-pass NDAA
item.description: The eleventh-hour battle to get annual defense authorization legislation over the finish line is testing both Speaker Mike Johnson’s ability to govern and the limits of GOP unity.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Texas' massive delegation is losing its sway
item.description: Today could determine whether the Lone Star State gets five more Republican-leaning seats next Congress. Yet the state’s Texas-sized influence is beginning to wane.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP fears what Tennessee means for 2026
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson held onto a much-needed red seat in Tennessee last night — but fellow Republicans say this isn’t cause for celebration.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: The health care talks to watch
item.description: Senators will be voting on health care in about a week. Their chances of success are not good.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Health deal hinges on Trump
item.description: Congress is back. Welcome to the December of Hellth.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor and Mia McCarthy
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor and Mia McCarthy

item.title: Trump sows more health care chaos
item.description: President Donald Trump is proceeding with health care talks on his own terms — making contradictory statements and sowing mass confusion within the Republican ranks as he slams the Obamacare subsidies while also opening the door to a bipartisan extension.
item.dc:creator: By Benjamin Guggenheim, Jordain Carney and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Benjamin Guggenheim, Jordain Carney and Calen Razor

item.title: Republicans bristle at Trump’s health care play
item.description: Welcome back to Donald Trump's Art of the Deal: Health Care Edition.
item.dc:creator: By Zachary Warmbrodt and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Zachary Warmbrodt and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Trump’s Obamacare move blindsides conservatives
item.description: The White House is poised to propose a two-year extension of Obamacare subsidies with new limits on eligibility.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Zachary Warmbrodt
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Zachary Warmbrodt

item.title: Things are not normal on Capitol Hill
item.description: After a seven-week recess, Speaker Mike Johnson was optimistic about making progress on urgent priorities like government funding and rising health care costs. Instead, the House used hours of floor time to vote five times this week on measures rebuking other members.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Where health care talks stand
item.description: The Senate’s leaving today for Thanksgiving recess without clear bipartisan agreement on how to address expiring Obamacare subsidies. But after a busy week of talks across the Capitol, we’re starting to get some clarity on what will or won’t pass muster in a year-end health care deal.
item.dc:creator: By Benjamin Guggenheim and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Benjamin Guggenheim and Calen Razor

item.title: GOP dreams face harsh legislative reality
item.description: The White House’s hopes for big legislative wins in the coming months are about to crash into the reality of the congressional GOP.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP tries to rip off the Epstein Band-Aid
item.description: Two big votes are hitting the House floor this afternoon, with each party caught between unity and accountability.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Trump blinks on Epstein as GOP rebels
item.description: President Donald Trump is coming to grips with his impending loss on the Jeffrey Epstein files and a rare moment of tenuous control over the House GOP.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Decision time on NDAA
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: The shutdown lurking around the corner
item.description: Congress finally ended a record-breaking six-week-long shutdown Wednesday. Now comes the hard part.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
